body:
Comment 1 by **gary.sims**: 
Doesn't making the path relative mean that binaries can't be deployed in the traditional
locations like /usr/bin as beneath it there would need to be the different cgo libraries
and I don't think cluttering up /usr/bin etc with cgo run-time libraries is a good idea! 

It would work for binaries deployed in their own directories or in /usr/local but not
for traditional system wide deployment.

A better option (IMHO) is to define (at compile time) an absolute place to the cgo
libraries (like say /usr/local/goruntime etc).

This way the binaries can be deployed (especcially servers and system utilities) in a
traditional fashion (i.e. in /usr/bin/ or /sbin or whatever).
